title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Matthew thought for a moment. "I saw an advertisement for a flat like ours in Northumberland Street," he said. "And Northumberland Street is a little bit less desirable than India Street.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: It is recorded that Scott spent much time with him one summer at his house in Melville Street, Portobello. He was at No. 23 Maitland Street, a few doors from Athol Crescent, in 1818, and a letter of his to Hogg was addressed from No. 25 Northumberland Street in 1821 ; but in his own correspondence, and in that of his friends, and in the printed gossip of his contemporaries,  no hint is given as to any other of his local habitations. Naturally he was often in Scott's various  houses, and a guest at all of the tables of all of the men of his own charming coterie.

title: The life and correspondence of Andrew Combe ...
author: Combe, George
snippet: On the 25th September 1833 George Combe was married  to Miss Cecilia Siddons, and removed to Charlotte Square, leaving Dr Combe and Miss Cox in possession of the house in Northumberland Street, in which they had previously lived together.

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "Then," Angus went on, "then there was another incident. A few days later, a man reported that he had been getting out of his car in Northumberland Street and he was given quite a nip on his ankle by a dog that then ran away in the direction of Nelson Street. The dog ripped the leg of his suit, apparently, and he reported the matter to the police so that he could claim insurance."

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: In Northumberland Street—-this and others I shallmention are short narrow streets or lanes leading off theStrand—lived Ben Jonson with his step-father, a bricklayer, and in Craven Street Dr. Benjamin Franklin residedin 1771. Charles Mathews, the comedian, was born in theStrand.

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "They had an identity parade," said Angus. "They lined up a group of dogs in Gayfield Square police station and they asked the Northumberland Street man to identify the dog which had bitten him. He picked out Cyril."

title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: At the eastern end of Northumberland Street the road took a sharp turn down to the left and became Nelson Street, a rather more promising street, Isabel had always thought. She had known a painter who lived there, in a top-floor flat with skylights that faced north and which admitted a clear light that suffused all his paintings.

title: Sunshine on Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They would find it easily enough, he decided. There would not be many red Volvos in Northumberland Street and it would be spotted easily. It was becoming quite distinguished, their car, now that modern cars all looked the same.

title: Curriculum Vitae: A Volume of Autobiography
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: Frances lived near Coolie's house; it was in Northumberland Street. We had such a 'pash' on Coolie, the infinitely glamorous, that we would walk up and down the street, quite unnecessarily, in the hope of catching sight of him.

title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: Reluctantly he accepted a lucrative post in the East, but he hated Calcutta, never ceased to be homesick,  and when he took his welcome release, hurried home like a schoolboy for the holidays. A telegram  from Southampton announcing his arrival to Northumberland Street, asked that next morning a boy should be sent as formerly for copy to his chambers in the Temple. The boy may have been sent, but in Stephen's absence Maine had stepped into his place as leading leader writer.

title: Letters of Asa Gray,
author: Gray, Asa
snippet: Saturday evening, January 19. I am now in lodgings, No. 36 Northumberland Street, near Northumberland  House, Charing Cross, in the room just vacated by Dr. Richardson ; sixteen shillings a week, and a shilling for my breakfast when I choose to take it here. It is half past eleven.

title: The life and correspondence of Andrew Combe ...

snippet: In consequence of the increasing success of George and Andrew Combe in their several professions, they left their residence in Brown Square, and in May 1827 removed to No. 25 Northumberland Street, in the New Town.

title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She stood there for a few minutes more, her gaze fixed on the closed door. Then she turned away and walked back up Northumberland Street, feeling dirtied by what she had seen, and by what she had done. In such a way, and with such a heart, must people creep away from brothels or the locus of an illicit assignation;   mortal, guilty, as WHA  would have it in that grave poem in which he describes the aftermath of the carnal, when sleeping heads might lie, so innocently, upon faithless arms.

title: Memoirs and correspondence of Francis Horner, M.P.
author: Horner, Francis
snippet: I was beginning to blame you for not writing ; and nothing has prevented me this week from writing to you, but military services. James Brougham and I joined the Bloomsbury Association ; and for ten days past have been drilling most indefatigably;  going from Northumberland Street up to the Foundling Hospital Ground twice every day. I have been at it three hours this morning, and my hand shakes so, that you see I cannot write.
